intro: Cabralea selloi var. parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered cabralea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit, with hairy stems and elliptical leaves. Its flowers are small, typically pink or purple, and clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forest environments.
